key_points: Alec Baldwin was described as very careful with firearms on the 'Rust' set by cameraman Reid Russell.
The affidavit for a search warrant reveals assistant director Dave Halls was unaware of live rounds in the prop gun given to Baldwin.
Detective Joel Cano's affidavit details how the tragic shooting incident occurred during a rehearsal.
Director Joel Souza and cinematographer Halyna Hutchins were preparing a scene when Baldwin discharged the firearm.
The affidavit suggests only one bullet was fired, which went through Hutchins and then struck Souza.
Hutchins reportedly said she couldn't feel her legs before receiving medical attention.
The affidavit highlights that the film's crew had issues, including a walkout by seven camera crew members hours before the incident.
Detective Cano noted challenges on the set, such as delays caused by having to find a replacement camera crew.
The spent casing from the fired prop gun was retrieved by the film’s armorer, Hannah Gutierrez, indicating a single shot was fired.
The Santa Fe Sheriff’s Department and District Attorney Mary Carmack-Altwies have announced a joint press conference regarding the investigation.
spokespersons: Joel Cano (Detective, Santa Fe Sheriff’s Department)
